turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: How can you close me up? On what grounds?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I am shocked, shocked to find that gambling is going on in here!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: But you haven't any actual proof, and you know it. This isn't Germany or occupied France. All you can do is fine him a few thousand francs and give him thirty days. You might as well let him go now.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Ricky, I'd advise you not to be too interested in what happens to Laszlo. If by any chance you were to help him escape --

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: -- What makes you think I'd stick my neck out for Laszlo?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Because one, you've bet ten thousand francs he'd escape. Two, you have the letters of transit, now don't bother to deny it. And, well, you might do it simply because you don't like Strasser's looks. As a matter of fact, I don't like him either.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Well, they're all excellent reasons.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Don't count too much on my friendship, Ricky. In this matter I'm powerless. Besides, I might lose ten thousand francs.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You're not very subtle, but you are effective. I, I get the point. Yes, I have the letters, but I intend using them myself. I'm leaving Casablanca on tonight's plane, the last plane.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: And I'm taking a friend with me. One you'll appreciate.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: What friend?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Ilsa Lund.  That ought to put your mind to rest about my helping Laszlo escape. The last man I want to see in America.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: You didn't come here to tell me this. You have the letters of transit. You can fill in your name and hers and leave any time you please. Why are you interested in what happens to Laszlo?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Ilsa is Laszlo's wife. She probably knows things that Strasser would like to know. Louis, I'll make a deal with you. Instead of this petty charge you have against him, you can get something really big, something that would chuck him in a concentration camp for years. That would be quite a feather in your cap, wouldn't it?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: It certainly would. Germany... Vichy would be very grateful.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Then release him. You be at my place a half hour before the plane leaves.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I'll arrange to have Laszlo come there to pick up the letters of transit, and that'll give you the criminal grounds on which to make the arrest. You get him, and we get away. To the Germans that last will be just a minor annoyance.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: There's still something about this business I don't quite understand. Miss Lund, she's very beautiful, yes, but you were never interested in any woman.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Well, she isn't just any woman.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I see. How do I know you'll keep your end of the bargain?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I'll make the arrangements right now with Laszlo in the visitor's pen.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Ricky, I'm going to miss you. Apparently you're the only one in Casablanca who has even less scruples than I.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Oh, thanks.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Go ahead, Ricky.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You're late.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I was informed just as Laszlo was about to leave the hotel, so I knew I'd be on time.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I thought I asked you to tie up your watchdogs.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Oh, he won't be followed here.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: You know, this place will never be the same without you, Ricky.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Yes, I know what you mean, but I've already spoken to Ferrari. You'll still win at roulette.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Is everything ready?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I have the letters right here.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Tell me, when we searched the place, where were they?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Sam's piano.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Serves me right for not being musical.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: -- Not so fast, Louis. Nobody's going to be arrested. Not for a while yet.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Have you taken leave of your senses?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I have. Sit down over there.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Put that gun down.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I suppose you know what you're doing, but I wonder if you realize what this means?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I do. We've got plenty of time to discuss that later.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Call off your watch-dogs you said.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Just the same, you call the airport and let me hear you tell them. And remember, this gun's pointed right at your heart.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: That is my least vulnerable spot.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: If you don't mind, you fill in the names. That will make it even more official.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: You think of everything, don't you?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: And the names are Mr. and Mrs. Victor Laszlo.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Well I was right. You are a sentimentalist.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Stay where you are. I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: What you just did for Laszlo, and that fairy tale that you invented to send Ilsa away with him. I know a little about women, my friend. She went, but she knew you were lying.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Anyway, thanks for helping me out.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I suppose you know this isn't going to be pleasant for either of us, especially for you. I'll have to arrest you of course.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: As soon as the plane goes, Louis.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Well, Rick, you're not only a sentimentalist, but you've become a patriot.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Maybe, but it seemed like a good time to start.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: I think perhaps you're right.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: It might be a good idea for you to disappear from Casablanca for a while. There's a Free French garrison over at Brazzaville. I could be induced to arrange a passage.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: My letter of transit? I could use a trip. But it doesn't make any difference about our bet. You still owe me ten thousand francs.

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: And that ten thousand francs should pay our expenses.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Our expenses?

turns.speaker: RENAULT
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Louis, I think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Where were you last night?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: That's so long ago, I don't remember.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Will I see you tonight?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I never make plans that far ahead.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Give me another.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Sacha, she's had enough.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Don't listen to him, Sacha. Fill it up.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Rick, I'm sick and tired of having you --

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: -- Sacha, call a cab.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Come on, we're going to get your coat.

turns.speaker: YVONNE
turns.text: Take your hands off me!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Make it official, if you like.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: What is your nationality?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I'm a drunkard.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: I understand you came here from Paris at the time of the occupation.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: There seems to be no secret about that.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Are you one of those people who cannot imagine the Germans in their beloved Paris?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: It's not particularly my beloved Paris.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Well, there are certain sections of New York, Major, that I wouldn't advise you to try to invade.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Aha. Who do you think will win the war?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I haven't the slightest idea.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Are my eyes really brown?

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: You will forgive my curiosity, Mr. Blaine. The point is, an enemy of the Reich has come to Casablanca and we are checking up on anybody who can be of any help to us.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: My interest in whether Victor Laszlo stays or goes is purely a sporting one.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: In this case, you have no sympathy for the fox, huh?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Not particularly. I understand the point of view of the hound, too.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Victor Laszlo published the foulest lies in the Prague newspapers until the very day we marched in, and even after that he continued to print scandal sheets in a cellar.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You'll excuse me, gentlemen. Your business is politics. Mine is running a saloon.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Good evening, Mr. Blaine.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: I would advise you not to interfere.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I was willing to shoot Captain Renault, and I'm willing to shoot you.

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Put that phone down!

turns.speaker: STRASSER
turns.text: Get me the Radio Tower!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Put it down!

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: Uh, excuse me, please. Hello, Rick.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Hello Ugarte.

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: Huh. You know, Rick, watching you just now with the Deutsches Bank, one would think you'd been doing this all your life.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Well, what makes you think I haven't?

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: Oh, nothing. But when you first came to Casablanca, I thought --

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: -- You thought what?

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: May I? Too bad about those two German couriers, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: They got a lucky break. Yesterday they were just two German clerks. Today they're the 'Honored Dead'.

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: You are a very cynical person, Rick, if you'll forgive me for saying so.

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: Thank you.  Will you have a drink with me please?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: I forgot. You never drink with...  I'll have another, please.  You despise me, don't you?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: If I gave you any thought, I probably would.

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: But why? Oh, you object to the kind of business I do, huh? But think of all those poor refugees who must rot in this place if I didn't help them. That's not so bad. Through ways of my own I provide them with exit visas.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: For a price, Ugarte, for a price.

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: But think of all the poor devils who cannot meet Renault's price. I get it for them for half. Is that so parasitic?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I don't mind a parasite. I object to a cut-rate one.

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: Well, Rick, after tonight I'll be through with the whole business, and I am leaving finally this Casablanca.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Who did you bribe for your visa? Renault or yourself?

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: Myself. I found myself much more reasonable.

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: One moment. Tonight I'll be selling those for more money than even I have ever dreamed of, and then, addio Casablanca! You know, Rick, I have many friends in Casablanca, but somehow, just because you despise me you're the only one I trust. Will you keep these for me? Please.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: For how long?

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: Perhaps an hour, perhaps a little longer.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I don't want them here overnight.

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: Don't be afraid of that. Please keep them for me. Thank you. I knew I could trust you.

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: Rick! Rick, help me!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Don't be a fool. You can't get away.

turns.speaker: UGARTE
turns.text: Rick, hide me. Do something! You must help me, Rick. Do something!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Sam, Ferrari wants you to work for him at the Blue Parrot.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I like it fine here.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: He'll double what I pay you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yeah, but I ain't got time to spend the money I make here.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Boss!

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Boss, ain't you going to bed?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Not right now.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Ain't you planning on going to bed in the near future?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You ever going to bed?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well, I ain't sleepy either.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Good. Then have a drink.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No. Not me, boss.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Then don't have a drink.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Boss, let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: No, sir. I'm waiting for a lady.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Please, boss, let's go. Ain't nothing but trouble for you here.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: She's coming back. I know she's coming back.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: We'll take the car and drive all night. We'll get drunk. We'll go fishing and stay away until she's gone.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Shut up and go home, will you?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No, sir. I'm staying right here.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: They grab Ugarte and she walks in. Well, that's the way it goes. One in, one out. Sam?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yeah, boss?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Sam, if it's December 1941 in Casablanca, what time is it in New York?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Uh, my watch stopped.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: I bet they're asleep in New York. I'll bet they're asleep all over America.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: What's that you're playing?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Just a little something of my own.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Well, stop it. You know what I want to hear.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No, I don't.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You played it for her and you can play it for me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well, I don't think I can remember it.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: If she can stand it, I can. Play it!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes, boss.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This sort of takes the sting out of being occupied, doesn't it, Mr. Richard?

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: You said it!  Here's looking at you, kid.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: And getting closer every minute. Here. Drink up. We'll never finish the other three.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: The Germans'll be here pretty soon now, and they'll come looking for you. And don't forget there's a price on your head.

turns.speaker: RICK
turns.text: Where is she? Have you seen her?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No, Mr. Richard. I can't find her.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: It took this test package thirty-two hours to get from Seattle to St. Petersburg, a distance of nine thousand miles.  And then it took forty-one hours to get from our warehouse in St. Petersburg to here, a distance of, what --

turns.speaker: ALEKSEI
turns.text: Six kilometers.  Four miles.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: So how are we going to get this place shaped up?

turns.speaker: ALEKSEI
turns.text: It's bad.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Worse than Warsaw.

turns.speaker: ALEKSEI
turns.text: Nobody remembers that.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: The failures they remember.  It's the successes they forget.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Save some for tomorrow.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Catch another fish tomorrow.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Shit!  Shit!  Shit!

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Stay calm, identify the problem. Problem, rope fraying.  Solution, fix rope.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: With what?  There's nothing to fix it with.  This rope comes undone, you're going to drown.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Get up.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Feels so good to lie here.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Get up, damn you.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Can't.  Need water.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: You've had today's water.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Thirsty.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Come on, shape up, get going, you can do it.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: No water, no work.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Okay look, I know you're tired, I know you're thirsty, but give it one more shot, you've just got to do a little more.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Do too much, I'll die.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Do too little you'll die.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Going to die anyway.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: No more water, you said.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Take it.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Take it, damn it.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Wilson, do you believe this?  Take the damn water.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: If they can't see you, what's the point?

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Survive today, that's the point.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Polaris, where are you?  Maybe I'm too far south.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: You don't know where you are.  You missed the shipping lanes.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Moon's too bright.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: You're putting off the inevitable.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: I'm putting it off.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Get water!

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Fix raft first.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Water water water --

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: You're beautiful.  Marry me.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: You idiot, if he dives, he'll capsize the raft.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Can't kill another one.  Can't.  Can't kill my friends anymore.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: You fucking bleeding heart, you kill or you die.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Why do they have to die for me?

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: They'd eat you if they could.  They're laughing at you.  Listen.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: I'm lost.  Goodbye.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Look, just slip off the raft.  The ocean would feel so good, the water's so soft and warm.  Take a little swim.  Sleep.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: You quitter you quitter you quitter.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: The sea is lovely, dark and deep.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: But I have promises to keep.  And miles to go before I sleep.  And miles to go before I sleep.  Got to fix the sea anchor.  Use the sail.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Use the sail for a sea anchor and you won't move.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: If I don't have a sea anchor I'll capsize.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Die tomorrow or die today.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: That's death knocking, knocking on your door.  Crazy little woman come knocking, knocking at my front door...

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Grow up, stop being such a baby.  Other people get through a lot worse.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Yeah, sure, what?

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: You know, Wilson, every now and then we should say thank you.  Thank you God.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Thank you for fucking up my life.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: What are you smiling about?  They'll be back.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: I'm dancing on the roof of the Peabody Hotel.  With Kelly.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: They're never going to see you.  You're just another piece of trash in the ocean.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: They're on autopilot.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: They're always on autopilot.  Or else it's night, or you're in the sun, or you're in the trough of a wave.  They'll never see you.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Damn it!  Don't be so negative!

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: I float.  You sink.  End of story.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: I'm serious.  I'm always going on about me, me, me.  Enough about me.  Your turn.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: It's a fucking soccer ball, you idiot.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: What's so damn funny?

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: You are.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Look again, asshole.  It's a mirage.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: It's real.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Nothing out there but ocean.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Let's get a second opinion.  Wilson? What do you see?

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: What did it matter if FedEx was five minutes late one day?  The next day we just start over again.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: It matters.  We do the best we can, that's all we have.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: Then we've just got shit.

turns.speaker: BADCHUCK
turns.text: You can't make it.

turns.speaker: GOODCHUCK
turns.text: Shut up.  I don't feel like dying today.

turns.speaker: BETTINA
turns.text: You came on a bicycle?  No wonder it's so late.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: There was an unavoidable delay.

turns.speaker: BETTINA
turns.text: Well, I have to say, I'm impressed.  You never gave up.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BETTINA
turns.text: You know what happened to this?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: As much as anybody.

turns.speaker: BETTINA
turns.text: Want to come in?  Get dry for a minute.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Okay.  Sure.

turns.speaker: BETTINA
turns.text: Hmmm.  Feels like it might have gotten wet.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Possible.  So you did those wings?

turns.speaker: BETTINA
turns.text: Yeah.  A long time ago.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: They're harder to do than they look.

turns.speaker: BETTINA
turns.text: Oh?  You've tried?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Well, I do a little drawing --

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Our apologies that it never made it to the recipient.

turns.speaker: BETTINA
turns.text: He was a sorry sonofabitch, and I'm sorry I ever married him.

turns.speaker: BETTINA
turns.text: I can't believe this.  I -- I -- They are... You're a gifted artist.  You're into something very powerful.  Primal. Truly.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Well, not really, I --

turns.speaker: BETTINA
turns.text: You are.  Yes you are.  What gave you the idea to paint on that cave?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: To tell you the truth -- you did.

turns.speaker: BETTINA
turns.text: Do you...have any more packages to deliver?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: No.  that was the last one.

turns.speaker: BETTINA
turns.text: Just sit here, I'll get us some lunch.

turns.speaker: BETTINA
turns.text: Keep painting.  Promise me.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: Did you really steal a crippled kid's bicycle to make your deliveries, or is that just some bullshit story?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I didn't steal it, and he wasn't crippled.

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: What brings you out to the sticks?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Had a package to deliver.

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: You?  Personally?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I had it on the island with me.

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: Must be a story there.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Yeah, a long one.

turns.speaker: ERICA
turns.text: I've got lots of time.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: So do I.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Sonofabitch!

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Hey, be nice to it, it'll be nice to you.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Your eyes are puffy.  Did you take Valium again?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: You smell like formaldehyde.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: My last chapter's in there, and the damn machine's jammed.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Let's take a look.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: How was Russia?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Cold.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Don't overwhelm me with details, you know how I hate that.  Did you get it fixed?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I thought I did.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Got to follow the paper path here.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Chuck, forget the Xerox.  So Russia didn't turn out well?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Chuck.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: What do you want me to say?  That I thought I'd done a great job but it all turned to shit?  That I might as well have gone sailing for all the good I did?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yeah, tell me.  Tell me all of it.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Merry Christmas eve.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Not if you work for FedEx.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Four four.  A record.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You don't seem too happy about it.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Ah, the staff meeting could have gone better.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Let me guess, Russia came up?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Hey, look at you.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I figure, if we could take care of a puppy, we could, you know, take care of --

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: He is a cute thing.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: He's your cute thing.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I can't even keep fish alive.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: A puppy's got a little more personality than a fish.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: And for you --

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: You know, for when you travel.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: For when I travel?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I have to go.  I'm on call for overflow down at the Hub.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: A ring.  I wanted a ring.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: You did?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Look, I love the puppy.  I love you.  But I have to go.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You can't go now.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I have to.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You want to.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: This isn't working out.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: We're a little emotional here.  It's Christmas, maybe we're over-reacting.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: "We're" not over-reacting.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Could you watch Jango?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I can't take him to work.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: That's your dog.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: It's our dog.  It belongs to us.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: There isn't any us.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Yes there is.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm sorry about the presents.  I got a little carried away.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: No, it was great.  Maybe a little overkill --

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I burned the Christmas tree.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Why didn't you come over, get mad at me, tell me what a stupid bitch I was.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I guess I hadn't thought through how I felt.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: What, you were going to come over the next day all calm and say, Kelly that really made me mad?  Don't tell me you're mad.  Be mad.  Be who you are right now.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Look, we'll do our trip as soon as I get back.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Don't even start.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Get back?  From where?

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Malaysia.  They're holding the sweep.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Chuck, you're breaking my heart.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: A week, max.  Okay?  Okay?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Go on.  We'll be fine.  I'll feed Jango to the frogs.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I'm sorry... I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: Hey...hey...it's okay!

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Right back, you said you'd be right back.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: A few things came up.  Or went down.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I got married.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I thought you might have.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I would never --

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: If I'd known you were alive --

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: I would have done the same thing.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I didn't want to.  It just happened.  One day Gary was there.  He took care of everything.  He took care of me.  I was a mess.

turns.speaker: CHUCK
turns.text: You have any children?
